c74object.name: bach.beatunbox
c74object.digest: Flatten measure-wise parameters into plain voice-wise information
c74object.description: Removes the measure parenthesis levels in the bach.score parameters syntax. More specifically, it converts the measure-wise score syntax into a plain sequence of separate parameters (boxed only voice-wise, and no longer measure-wise).

inlet.digest: Whole bach.score gathered syntax, or Measureinfo (in separate mode only), or bang

outlet.digest: Extras (only existing when the mode is NOT "separate")

objarg.name: separate
objarg.description: Put a "separate" symbol as argument if you want to input the separate parameters (and not the bach.score gathered syntax).

method.name: bang
method.description: Perform the unboxing operation on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Receive score syntax and remove the measure parenthesis level.
method.description:
The function by default receives the score gathered syntax (obtained via a "dump" message). In most cases this suffice.
On the other hand, if the separate argument is needed, the function receives: In first inlet: Cents.
In second inlet: Durations, as output by bach.score' dump (measure-wise).
In third inlet: Velocities.
In fourth inlet: Ties.
In fifth inlet: Extras.
All parameters are expected as output by bach.score' dump (measure-wise), but NOT with rhythmic tree parenthesization (so be sure that

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: bach.beatunbox is the complementary object with respect to bach.beatbox. It converts a measure-wise packets of data into a continuous flow, gathering (where possible) the tied elements, and merging sequences of rests. The basic usage is by connecting its inlet with score's gathered syntax dump. If you use the "separate" mode (by putting the "separate" argument), be sure that the score output of the separate parameters be not in rhythmic-tree form, by checking the @outputtrees bach.score attribute (by default it is not).
